newsitem.title: FRANCE: Paris says has no sign Mobutu planning exile.
newsitem.headline: Paris says has no sign Mobutu planning exile.

text.p: France has no indication that Zaire's embattled President Mobutu Sese Seko could be planning exile in France, where he has a Riviera villa, the foreign ministry said on Thursday.
"We do not know the intentions of President Mobutu, so the possibility of exile is not a current question," ministry spokesman Foreign Ministry Jacques Rummelhardt told Reuters.
Mobutu, who came to power in 1965, went to Gabon on Thursday for a mini-summit with a handful of fellow French-speaking African presidents to try to find a peaceful end to the war.

Rummelhardt noted that Mobutu "has come here in the past for medical treatment". Mobutu underwent surgery for prostate cancer in Switzerland last August and has spent several months convalescing in a luxury villa overlooking the Mediterranean.

Zaire's Information Minister Kin-Kiey Mulumba rejected suggestions that Mobutu's departure for Gabon was a veiled flight into exile and said the veteran leader would return to his capital after the meeting.
Bill Richardson, U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, was in Paris on Thursday for talks on the Zaire crisis after a trip to the region last week.
